rules.Name: asax-dotNet
rules.Advice: Convert to Spring based application configuration.

rules.Name: config-logging
rules.Advice: Logging to the Event Log is not recommended for cloud native apps.  Consider refactoring to use a ConsoleTraceListener with the System.Diagnostics logging system.

rules.Name: config-securiy
rules.Advice: Use of generated machine keys can cause problems in cloud applications when they are scaled.  Consider disabling use of Machine Keys, or explicitly set the key in your configuration.

rules.Name: config-sessionState
rules.Advice: App should be executed as a stateless process. Store session state externally

Patterns.Advice: WCF is supported with no transport security
Disable HTTPS at the container and allow the external load balancer to terminate SSL
Transport security at the container is not supported.  Disable transport security on the service

rules.Name: cs-database-access
rules.Advice: Typically, applications using databases need to be converted to receive their connection strings from the environment.  Use Project Steeltoe (steeltoe.io) to easily inject cloud provided service bindings.

rules.Name: cs-fileIO
rules.Advice: Relying on the local filesystem to store state is unreliable in a cloud platform.  Since containers are immutable, restarts will lose any written changes.  Refactor this logic to use an external service to store state.

Patterns.Advice: Calling File.Open (investigate further to determine refactor rating)
Direct construction of FileStream (investigate further to determine refactor rating)

rules.Name: cs-launchProcess
rules.Advice: Launching additional processes within a container is not recommended.  Consider refactoring this code to either embed the functionality, or establish a separate service.

rules.Name: cs-logging
rules.Advice: Logging to the Event Log is not recommended for cloud native apps.  Consider refactoring to use a ConsoleTraceListener with the System.Diagnostics logging system.

rules.Name: cs-security
rules.Advice: Relying on Windows certificate stores is problematic in a cloud environment.  Ensure that you either load the certificates you need into the store Just-in-Time or consider refactoring your code to lookup certificates from the environment or another external service.

rules.Name: cs-wcf
rules.Advice: When using HTTPS, terminate SSL at load balancer

Patterns.Advice: Disable HTTPS at the container and allow the external load balancer to terminate SSL
Transport security at the container is not supported.  Disable transport security on the service

rules.Name: cs-windowsRegistry
rules.Advice: External configurations should be made available by environment variables or some other external service such as Spring Cloud Config Server.  App should have no dependencies on OS registry.

rules.Name: P-P-WindowsServices_~cs
rules.Advice: Don't rely on Windows Services as CloudFoundry manages the lifecycle of your service.  Convert any Windows service to a console application to run in Cloud Foundry.

rules.Name: csproj-netFramework
rules.Advice: Switch to .NET Framework 4.0 or later, or consider migration to .NET Core

rules.Name: java-3rdPartyImports
rules.Advice: Refer to 3rd party organization for cloud affinity of library

rules.Name: java-annotations
rules.Advice: Refer to PCF/Spring documentation for remediation

rules.Name: java-glassfish-import
rules.Advice: Refer to 3rd party organization for cloud affinity of library

rules.Name: java-jaxrs-import
rules.Advice: Refer to PCF/Spring documentation for remediation

rules.Name: java-jboss
rules.Advice: Convert to Spring based POJOs instead of using container specific functionality

rules.Name: java-jndiSpring
rules.Advice: Convert to Spring Beans and dependency injection

rules.Name: java-jpa
rules.Advice: JPA will work inside of Cloud Native applications, but changes may need to be made to the way JPA is configured to get connections

rules.Name: java-oracle-import
rules.Advice: Refer to PCF/Spring documentation for remediation

rules.Name: java-rabbitmq-import
rules.Advice: Refer to PCF/Spring documentation for remediation

rules.Name: java-weblogic
rules.Advice: Move away from container specific APIs to portal APIs such as Spring

rules.Name: java-websphere
rules.Advice: Move away from container specific APIs to portal APIs such as Spring
